list_definition.definition: a jewelled/jeweled ornament for the head, similar to a crown

list_ex_of_english: Dressed in a blue gown and diamond tiara, she also clasped a silver wand.
The door leads to an ancient tomb, within which they encounter a mysterious, ghostly woman wearing a golden tiara with a pearl set in it.
The prize package included a $100,000 cash award, a custom-designed platinum and diamond crown necklace, and tiaras.
Having no papal treasures on hand the noblewomen of the city manufactured the famous papier-mch papal tiara.
Women's evening dress included obligatory trains and tiaras or feathers in their hair (or both).
Popes ceased to wear papal tiaras in 1963, although their usage has not been formally abolished.
The tiara and keys are typical symbols used in the coats of arms of pontiffs, which symbolize their authority.
Instead of the papal tiara, he wore a jewelled mitre (the episcopal "mitra pretiosa").
